New Records: Milwaukee Brewers clinched their third NL Central title in the last four years
Brewers won consecutive division titles for the first time in 42 years
Willy Adames is the first Brewers shortstop to have a 30-homer, 100-RBI season
Jackson Chourio is the youngest player to hit 20 homers and steal 20 bases in one season
Key Match Events: Jake Bauers' ninth-inning RBI single gave the Brewers a 2-1 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies
Blue-and-gold streamers fell into the American Family Field stands as the team gathered in shallow center field to celebrate
Post-Match Reflections: Rhys Hoskins said, 'Nobody wants it to be easy, let’s just be honest. Everybody that’s in that room cherishes challenges. The first challenge (is) down. We obviously have a few more ahead of us. We’re excited about that.'

Pat Murphy said, 'You can do all that to us, but it’s still about people, and you have no idea what their best is. These guys don’t know what their best is and didn’t know what their best was and still don’t. But they know one thing: Pulling together, competing, being doubted is something that can vault you forward into a championship.'

Christian Yelich said, 'We were all kind of written off, right? So that makes this one kind of special because we found a way. We faced a lot of adversity. We believed in each other. We came together as a group and got it done.'

Rhys Hoskins said, 'This is exactly what you as a competitor want to be a part of, right? It didn’t necessarily look exactly the way that maybe some of us thought, but what’s cool is that we still were able to find ways to get the job done.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Milwaukee Brewers became the first major league team to clinch a postseason spot in 2024
Milwaukee Brewers have made the playoffs six times in the last seven years
Milwaukee Brewers have used 17 starting pitchers this season
Twelve different Brewers pitchers have earned a save, two shy of the record of 14 set by the 2021 Tampa Bay Rays
Milwaukee entered Wednesday with a 3.65 ERA that ranked fourth in the majors
Milwaukee entered Wednesday ranked fourth in runs (733) and 11th in OPS (.735)
